blocks.value: Luke was a Greek and a Gentile convert to the faith. He was a physician and evangelist. Some believe that Luke was a native of Antioch. Luke was a close companion of St. Paul and traveled with him on his missionary journeys. Luke accompanied Paul to Rome.

Luke wrote the Gospel that bears his name and the Acts of the Apostles. Both works are addressed to Theophilus (Lover of God). The Gospel of St. Luke emphasizes God's mercy and compassion. More than any other Gospel, Luke shows Jesus' special love and concern for women, the poor, sinners, Samaritans, and the sick. Luke's account of the Infancy of Jesus is most beautiful and tender.

Tradition relates that Luke was also a painter and that he painted several portraits of the Blessed Virgin Mary. St. Luke is the patron saint of physicians and surgeons, as well as artists and painters.
